definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: And at what rate do you discount those cash flows?
sentences.chinese: 现金流折现率又是多少呢？

sentences.english: Analyze free cash flow discount method in the application of the applicability of our country;
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，自由现金流量折现法在我国的具体运用。

sentences.english: The actual rate discount would have to be applied in the credit card management system.
sentences.chinese: 实际折现率将必须应用到信用卡管理系统中。

sentences.english: Therefore, free cash flow discount is the best measurement method for evaluation of enterprise value.
sentences.chinese: 因此，现金流折现法是衡量企业价值的最好手段。

sentences.english: Sell the gold back and put the money towards a new style.
sentences.chinese: 你应该把黄金卖回去，折现转去买新样式。

sentences.english: Thetrade-off amount is a discount against the future constant.
sentences.chinese: 权衡量相对未来恒量是折现。

sentences.english: The main consideration is discount rate what should be.
sentences.chinese: 主要考虑是折现率应该是什么。

sentences.english: It contains a condition attribute that describes the actual rate discount.
sentences.chinese: 它包含一个描述实际折现率的条件属性。

sentences.english: If you can increase your conversion rate, you can make more money within less time.
sentences.chinese: 如果能够提高折现率，你就能在短时间内挣更多钱。

sentences.english: What should the discount rate be?
A fast growth rate makes for a high discount rate.
sentences.chinese: 一个快速的经济增长率导致了高折现率。

sentences.english: The discount rate measures how fast the value of goods diminishes with time.
sentences.chinese: 折现率度量了产品价值随着时间而减少的速度。

definition: to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
to compensate/to make good (a financial loss)
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
